result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:33 PM Defendant Brittney Ann Hart appeared by video, Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared by video for Brittney Ann Hart, Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Defendant will be exercising her right to substitution.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for March 11, 2022.  
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:06 PM Defendant Brittney Ann Hart not in court, Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared in court for Brittney Ann Hart, Attorney Jacalyn Labre appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense received an offer letter. Defense requests an adjourned preliminary date or stay of the warrant. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's preliminary hearing. 
The Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant and orders forfeiture of cash bail.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 01-19-22 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance on January 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail, by zoom.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC-2nd offense and possess cocaine-2nd offense.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-10-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
